sen.j: 佐々木 中沢（ささき ちゅうたく、寛政2年（1790年） - 弘化3年4月1日 (旧暦)（1846年4月26日））は、江戸時代の蘭学者。
sen.e: Chutaku SASAKI (1790 - April 26, 1846) was Rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) of Edo period.
Chutaku SASAKI (1790 - April 26, 1846) was a rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) in Edo period.
sen.cmt: ・aを追加 ・inに変更 ・ｒに変更しました。
sen.e: Chutaku SASAKI (1790 - April 26, 1846) was a rangakusha (a person who studied Western sciences by means of the Dutch language) in Edo period.
His azana (adult male's nickname) was Churan, and his gago (pseudonym) was Rangu.
sen.cmt: 原文の「名」は「字（あざな）」、「号」は「雅号」のことと解釈し訳出しました。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was Churan, and his gago (pseudonym) was Rangu.
His azana (adult male's nickname) was Churan, and his gago (pseudonym) was Rangu.

sen.j: 陸奥国磐井郡上黒沢村（現岩手県一関市萩荘）に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Kamikurosawa village, Iwai County, Mutsu Province (present-day Hagisho, Ichinoseki City, Iwate Prefecture).
He was born in Kamikurosawa Village, Iwai County, Mutsu Province (present-day Hagisho, Ichinoseki City, Iwate Prefecture).
He was born in Kamikurosawa Village, Iwai County, Mutsu Province (present-day Hagisho, Ichinoseki City, Iwate Prefecture).

sen.j: 郷里の藩医・建部清庵に学び、25歳で江戸へ出て、建部の弟子であり郷里の先輩でもある蘭学者・大槻玄沢の芝蘭堂に入塾。
sen.e: After studying under Seian TAKEBE, a doctor of his native domain, he went to Edo at the age of 25 and entered Shirando: a private school of Rangakusha Gentaku OTSUKI, who was a pupil of TAKEBE and was also from SASAKI's home town and older than him.
sen.cmt: 「藩医」は用語検索で "Edo-period doctor working at a public clinic" とありますが、藩医が必ずしも public clinic で働いていたとは限らないようなので、ここでは使用しませんでした。
sen.e: After studying under a doctor of his native domain Seian TAKEBE, at the age of 25, he went to Edo to enter a private school called Shirando ran by a rangakusha Gentaku OTSUKI who was a senior pupil of TAKEBE in the same hometown.
sen.cmt: ・できるだけピリオドを少なくする為に文を変更しました。
sen.e: After studying under a doctor of his native domain Seian TAKEBE, at the age of 25, he went to Edo to enter a private school called Shirando ran by a rangakusha Gentaku OTSUKI who was a senior pupil of TAKEBE in the same hometown.

sen.j: オランダ外科を学び、宇田川玄真・橋本宗吉・山村才助・稲村三伯ら芝蘭堂四天王と呼ばれた門人に次ぐ玄沢の高弟となった。
sen.e: He learned Dutch surgery and became one of Gentaku's leading pupils, ranking next to the big four of Shirando: Genshin UDAGAWA, Sokichi HASHIMOTO, Saisuke YAMAMURA and Sanpaku INAMURA.
He learned Dutch surgery and became one of Gentaku's leading pupils, ranking next below the big four of Shirando: Genshin UDAGAWA, Sokichi HASHIMOTO, Saisuke YAMAMURA and Sanpaku INAMURA.
sen.cmt: ・四天王の下の高弟なのでtoを削除してbelowに変更しました。
sen.e: He learned Dutch surgery and became one of Gentaku's leading pupils, ranking next below the big four of Shirando: Genshin UDAGAWA, Sokichi HASHIMOTO, Saisuke YAMAMURA and Sanpaku INAMURA.

sen.j: 後に馬場佐十郎、桂川甫賢にも学んでいる。
sen.e: He later also studied under Sajuro BABA and Hoken KATSURAGAWA.
He later also studied under Sajuro BABA and Hoken KATSURAGAWA.
He later also studied under Sajuro BABA and Hoken KATSURAGAWA.

sen.j: 1817年、一関藩の藩医となり、師匠家の筋にあたる大槻清臣の長女・恵和子と結婚する。
sen.e: He became a doctor of the Ichinoseki domain in 1817 and married Ewako who was the eldest daughter of Kiyomi OTSUKI, a relative of his master.
sen.cmt: 「藩医」は用語検索で "Edo-period doctor working at a public clinic" とありますが、藩医が必ずしも public clinic で働いていたとは限らないようなので、ここでは使用しませんでした。「恵和子」読み方不明ですが、"Ewako"としました。「清臣」も読み方不明ですが、"Kiyomi"としました。
sen.e: He became a doctor of the Ichinoseki domain in 1817 and married to Ewako who was the eldest daughter of Kiyomi OTSUKI, a relative of his master.
He became a doctor of the Ichinoseki domain in 1817 and married to Ewako who was the eldest daughter of Kiyomi OTSUKI, a relative of his master.

sen.j: 1822年には玄沢・甫賢の推薦により、仙台藩医学校蘭方外科助教となる。
sen.e: In 1822, he became an assistant professor of Dutch surgery at the medical school in Sendai Domain by the recommendation of Gentaku and Hoken.
In 1822, he became an assistant professor of Dutch surgery at the medical school in Sendai Domain by the recommendation of Gentaku and Hoken.
In 1822, he became an assistant professor of Dutch surgery at the medical school in Sendai Domain by the recommendation of Gentaku and Hoken.

sen.j: 著書には、女囚の生殖器を解剖した際に記述した『存真図腋』（ぞんしんずえき）、コレラの症状や予防法を記した『壬午天行病説』などがある。
sen.e: He wrote some books including "Zonshinzueki," which was written when he dissected the genitals of a female prisoner; and "Jingo Tenkobyo Setsu," which described the symptoms of and preventive measures against cholera, and so on.

He wrote some books including "Zonshinzueki" which was written when he dissected the genitals of a female prisoner and "Jingo Tenkobyo Setsu" which described the symptoms of and preventive measures against cholera and so on.

sen.j: 大槻玄沢の息子・大槻磐渓との親しい関係は生涯続いた。
sen.e: His friendly relations with Bankei OTSUKI, a son of Gentaku OTSUKI, lasted for life.
